logic.dataPreservation

Class Loader

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.dataPreservation.Loader

  • public class Loader
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that implements the procedures needed to work with the filechooser

      • saveWithoutGUI

        public static void saveWithoutGUI(java.lang.String filename,
                                  Game game)
        Saving process used in the tests to avoid calling a javafx gui
        Parameters:
        filename - name of the directory to which the given Game should be saved. The file is located in the directory defined in the according field of this class.
        game - game instance that should be saved

      • openGivenFile

        public static java.lang.String openGivenFile(java.lang.String filePath)
                                      throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        opens a the string from the given filepath in its' string representation
        Parameters:
        filePath - filepath from which the string should be read
        Returns:
        string that was saved in the file at the specified location
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - Exception that will be thrown if the file was not found

        file - file from which the content should be read
        Returns:

      • saveFile

        public void saveFile(java.lang.String input)
        Saves a given input to an already chosen directory. If no directory was selected beforehand the method saveFileAs(...) will be called.
        Parameters:
        input - text that will be saved

      • saveFileAs

        public void saveFileAs(java.lang.String input)
        Opens a Filechooser and saves the given input to the desired location with a given name.
        Parameters:
        input - text that will be saved

      • openFileChooser

        public java.lang.String openFileChooser()
                                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Method to convert a file to a String Opens a filechooser and the user can then select the file he want to load. Besides returning the String value, the file attribut in the Loader class will be updated

        Source: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4716503/reading-a-plain-text-file-in-java

        Returns:
        String value saved in the selected file
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - that will be thrown if the selected file was not found
